data.name: Advance Shop
data.description: The Advance Shop, also known as the 100 Rupee Advance Shop, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a unique store as it can only be accessed when the game is played on a Game Boy Advance.

data.name: Aboda Village
data.description: Aboda Village is a location is Spirit Tracks. It is located by the southwestern shore of the Forest Realm. It is Link's hometown and the starting point of his journey.

data.name: Ancient Tree Stump
data.description: The Ancient Tree Stump is a location in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Abandoned Fort
data.description: The Abandoned Fort is a Keep in Hyrule Warriors.

data.name: Abandoned North Mine
data.description: The Abandoned North Mine is a location in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Ancient Shrine
data.description: Ancient Shrines are dungeon-like puzzles in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Daqo Chisay Shrine
data.description: The Daqo Chisay Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Whole Picture, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Ancient Columns
data.description: The Ancient Columns are a location in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Darb Pond
data.description: Darb Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Damel Forest
data.description: The Damel Forest is a location in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Zora Seas
data.description: The Zora Seas constitute a vast sea in the land of Labrynna in Oracle of Ages. As the name suggests, the Zora Seas are home to the Zoras . The Zora Seas are found to the west of the Sea of Storms, from whence the water flows. To the north is the South Shore and the Fairies' Woods. The only noticeable landmark of the Zora Seas is the Eyeglass Island Library.

data.name: Hyrule Underground
data.description: The Hyrule Underground is a location in The Minish Cap.

data.name: Dalite Forest
data.description: Dalite Forestis a location in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Page 12
data.description: Page 12 is a location in Ripened Tingle's Balloon Trip of Love.

data.name: Ancient Harbor
data.description: The Ancient Harbor is a location in Skyward Sword. It is an ancient port which linked the land of Lanayru Desert to the ancient ocean, now known as the Lanayru Sand Sea.

data.name: Daqa Koh Shrine
data.description: The Daqa Koh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Stalled Flight, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Hyrule
data.description: The Kingdom of Hyrule, also simply known as Hyrule, the Land of the Gods, the Lesser Kingdom of Hyrule, the Surface, and Hyrule Kingdom, is the name of the kingdom that serves as the iconic setting for a majority of the games in the Zelda series. It is usually depicted as a beautiful and prosperous land blessed with deep forests, tall mountains, vast lakes, a barren desert, great cities, villages, and many ancient temples hidden throughout.

data.name: Pondo
data.description: Pondo is a character in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Zora River
data.description: Zora River, also known as Zora's River, is a recurring location in the The Legend of Zelda series. It is one of the main bodies of water in Hyrule, with its water source being either Zora's Domain or Zora's Fountain.

data.name: Dako Tah Shrine
data.description: The Dako Tah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Electric Path, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

data.name: Reesong Palace
data.description: Reesong Palace is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. It the game's final stage and is unlocked after completing Shutoy Lake.

data.name: Hyrule Town Well
data.description: The Hyrule Town Well is a location in The Minish Cap.

data.name: Dark Ruins
data.description: The Dark Ruins is a location in A Link Between Worlds.

data.name: Hyrule Town Square
data.description: Hyrule Town Square is a location in The Minish Cap.

data.name: Dance Hall
data.description: The Dance Hall is a location in Oracle of Seasons.

data.name: Ordon Woods
data.description: Ordon Woods is a location in Twilight Princess.

data.name: Ordon Spring
data.description: Ordon Spring, also known as the Forest Spring, is a location in Twilight Princess. It is situated in the Ordon Woods and serves as the home of Ordona, the first Spirit of Light.
